unnormalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why Film Festivals are More Than Just Chai and Chat!
normalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why Film Festivals are More Than Just Chai and Chat!

unnormalised: Hey cinephiles! Tired of the same old Bollywood masala and Hollywood reboots? Want to dive deep into stories that actually *mean* something? Then listen up, because I'm about to preach the gospel of film festivals.
normalised: Hey cinephiles! Tired of the same old Bollywood masala and Hollywood reboots? Want to dive deep into stories that actually *mean* something? Then listen up, because I'm about to preach the gospel of film festivals.

unnormalised: Think film festivals are just for artsy types sipping chai and debating the merits of black and white photography? Think again! They're so much more. Imagine discovering a hidden gem of a movie made by a debut director from, say, Shillong. A film you wouldn’t have EVER seen otherwise! That's the magic, yaar.

Imagine discovering a hidden gem of a movie made by a debut director from, say, Shillong. A film you wouldn’t have ever seen otherwise! That's the magic, yaar.

unnormalised: I remember attending the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa a few years back. It was a total sensory overload! From catching a Satyajit Ray retrospective (talk about legendary!), to bumping into budding filmmakers pitching their scripts, the energy was electric.
normalised: I remember attending the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa a few years back. It was a total sensory overload! From catching a Satyajit Ray retrospective (talk about legendary!), to bumping into budding filmmakers pitching their scripts, the energy was electric.

unnormalised: Seriously, it's not just about the films themselves (though those are obviously a big draw). It's the atmosphere. It’s the conversations you have with complete strangers about the film you just watched. It's discovering a director whose style resonates with you on a level you never thought possible.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: Bollywood is your local mithai shop – you know what you're getting, and it's usually pretty sweet. Film festivals are like stumbling upon a tiny, hidden bakery in Chandni Chowk that makes the most incredible, unique desserts you've ever tasted.

unnormalised: Plus, many festivals offer workshops and Q&As with filmmakers. Imagine asking Karan Johar *himself* about his creative process! Okay, maybe not *every* festival has Karan Johar, but you get the idea.
normalised: Plus, many festivals offer workshops and Q and A’s with filmmakers. Imagine asking Karan Johar *himself* about his creative process! Okay, maybe not *every* festival has Karan Johar, but you get the idea.

unnormalised: So, ditch the Netflix binge for a weekend and explore your local film festival scene. You might just find your new favorite movie…or discover a whole new world of cinema! There are tons of festivals, big and small, happening all over India. Check out film festivals happening near you, maybe even drive 100 km for a particularly interesting one! You won't regret it! (Maybe just pack some extra snacks...festival food can be a little pricey – like Rs. 250 for a samosa pricey!)
